inclusion.criterion: Normal IQ as estimated by the Wechsler Test of Adult Reading (WTAR)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Able to live independently and complete activities of daily living
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Prior surgical resection for treatment of seizures
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Progressive neurologic illness (i.e. tumor evident on MRI)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease, nutritional deficiency, infection or metabolic/electrolyte disorder causing memory loss
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Seizure(s) must not have occurred within 3 days of testing
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects who are pregnant will not be eligible to take part in the study
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 41 year old man with history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy presenting with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity. Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.
